description: {"blocks":[{"key":"44g5d","text":"This protocol is for using beads as a cleanup step after protein is digested using a different method (not directly on  Sera-Mag beads), for example solution digest. The peptides are precipitated onto the beads to allow for removal of salts and detergents that will interfere with downstream mass spectrometry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6llho","text":"Stock Solution of magnetic Sera-Mag beads is made in section 1 of BAF_Protocol_004 and can be stored at 4C indefinitely and used as needed (never freeze).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4sbsn","text":"Peptide digest (for example from a solution or in-gel digest) should be reduced in volume so that a 95% ACN (acetonitrile) final concentration can be made within the Eppendorf tube volume. This will precipitate the peptides onto the beads for clean-up. See next steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2i28","text":"To the peptide digest that has been reduced in volume, add 2uL of bead stock mix (20ug).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49n92","text":"Add 100% ACN to a final concentration of 95% ACN. Incubate for 8 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bmpc","text":"Placed tubes on a magnetic rack for 2 minutes. Remove and discard supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cd0ph","text":"Rinse beads with 180uL of 100% ACN, incubate for 30s then remove and discard supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duh9t","text":"Add 10uL of 2% DMSO in water. Give quick spin (2-3s) in bench-top centrifuge to aid liquid removal from tube walls to bottom of tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"affpb","text":"Place tubes in magnetic rack for 2 minutes and recover supernatant making sure not to recover any beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5a7g1","text":"Dilute samples with 0.1% FA (formic acid in water) to \u003c1% DMSO. Further clean-up using C18 tips may be done using BAF_Protocol_003.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: BAF_Protocol_006 On-Bead Peptide Cleanup (Digested by Other Method)
